topics.body:
I have a dumb random question: why is it that any fringe group when it's about to lose claims victory even when whatever the group is falling apart?


If you're wondering what I mean I'm reading up on gay marriage and the anti-glbt rights movement is claiming that they're going to "bounce back" and "get rid of gay marriage in all 50 states" and I'm just sitting here thinking, "how dense are you?" cause by june the numbers of states where gay marriage is legal is projected to be between 43 to 45 and over the next year the last few states will slowly cave in.  Also the majority of people opposed to glbt rights believe that the majority of people on their side.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54fe09366368727391161e00#post_54fe09366368727391161e00
Denial is the first stage of grief.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54fe09366368727391161e00#post_54fe09366368727391161e00
They're fanatics. They would desperately try to keep up their morale to the very end. It's one of those "Fight to the last person" type of mentality. Most notably, the Nazis kept their propaganda machine going even when Soviet troops were roaming the streets of Berlin and the city was being shelled by Katyusha rockets. 

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54fe0a5363687213fedf1500#post_54fe0a5363687213fedf1500
And/or that.
